meanings.definition: To sleep longer or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outslept her sister during the weekend sleepover.
meanings.sent2: He always outslept his friends on camping trips.
meanings.sent3: The cat outslept the dog and got the best spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner outslept his competitors and won the race.
meanings.sent5: The owl outslept the other birds, waking up only at dusk.

meanings.sent1: She had outslept everyone in the house last night.
meanings.sent2: He outslept his alarm and was late for work.
meanings.sent3: The bear outslept the winter and woke up hungry.
meanings.sent4: The student had outslept the deadline for the assignment.
meanings.sent5: The cat outslept the storm and emerged unscathed.
